pr_title: fix: don't cleanup topics on engine close

timeline.message:
fix: don't cleanup topics on engine close

Co-authored-by: Rohan <desai.p.rohan@gmail.com>

fix: don't cleanup topics on engine close

Co-authored-by: Rohan <desai.p.rohan@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyHTML:
How about?

Suggested change
verifyNoMoreInteractions(closeCallback);
verify(kafkaStreams).close(Duration.ofMillis(closeTimeout));
verify(closeCallback, never()).accept(any());

Or add another test that checks ks.close is called on stop.
timeline.author: big-andy-coates

timeline.body:
I'd be tempted to make this abstract and move this impl to `PersistentQuery`.

No biggie, just feels cleaner to me.
timeline.bodyText:

timeline.author: big-andy-coates

replies.bodyText: I wanted to do that, but there's a place where QueryMetadata is actually being instantiated directly. Not sure if that's a bug, but I didn't want to deal with it now.
replies.author: agavra

replies.bodyText: Looks like this is used from the new API code: for transient queries. So this should default to cleaning up internal topics.
replies.author: big-andy-coates
big-andy-coates

timeline.bodyHTML:
nit:

Suggested change
verify(topicClient, times(0)).deleteInternalTopics(any());
verify(topicClient, never()).deleteInternalTopics(any());

timeline.bodyHTML:
nit:

Suggested change
verify(kafkaStreams, times(0)).cleanUp();
verify(kafkaStreams, never()).cleanUp();
